intro: Hieracium aeolochroum, commonly known as the Aeolochrous hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium aeolochroum is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth habit and ability to colonize new areas quickly.
